com.colofabrix.mathparser.org

Class OpBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.colofabrix.mathparser.org.OpBuilder

  • public final class OpBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates operators

    This class offer an easy and standard way to create context-operators. A context-operator is an operator with a reference to an operator manager and a memory

    Author:
    Fabrizio Colonna

      • OpBuilder

        public OpBuilder()

    • Method Detail

      • createOperator

        public static Operator createOperator(java.lang.Class<? extends Operator> operator)
        Creates a new operator with a context

        The methd first instantiate a new Operator and the it sets its context
        Please note that a call to newContext() or to setMemory(Memory)/ setOperators(Operators) must be done to ensure the presence of a context.

        Parameters:
        operator - The operator to be created
        Returns:
        A new instance of the specified operator or null if errors during the instantiation

      • getMemory

        public static Memory getMemory()
        Gets the current memory
        Returns:
        A reference to the currently used memory

      • getOperators

        public static Operators getOperators()
        Gets the current operator manager
        Returns:
        A reference to the currently used operator manager

      • newContext

        public static boolean newContext()
        Create a new context

        A context is the pair that identifies a working area for the operators
        The new context will be applied every time createOperator(Class) is called

        Returns:
        true if the context is renewd, false otherwise.

      • setMemory

        public static void setMemory(Memory memory)
        Sets the current memory

        memory -
